response0.improvementExplanation: RDDs are less efficient than DataFrames/Datasets for structured data processing. DataFrames/Datasets offer query optimizations, reduced shuffling, and easier integration with structured data formats.
response0.benefits: Improved performance, reduced shuffling, easier integration with structured data formats.

response0.improvementExplanation: RDD transformations can be inefficient for structured data processing. DataFrames/Datasets offer optimized transformations and reduced shuffling.
response0.benefits: Improved performance, reduced shuffling, optimized transformations.

response2.improvementExplanation: map() is less efficient for partition-level operations like calculating bonuses. mapPartitions() can improve performance by processing data in batches.
response2.mapPartitionsEquivalent: bonus_rdd = high_salary_rdd.mapPartitions(lambda partition: map(lambda emp: (emp[0], emp[1], float(emp[2]) * 1.1), partition))
response2.benefits: Improved performance, reduced function call overhead, optimized I/O.
